message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study utilizes data on agricultural production and sales from the Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (ISA) in Ghana, Nigeria, and Tanzania.", "dataset": ["Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This report examines the relationship between disaster risk management and financial sector development using data from the World Bank's Global Financial Development Database and the United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction's global assessment report.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Global Financial Development Database", "United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction's global assessment report"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the impact of extractive industries on governance in sub-Saharan African countries using both firm-level and household-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Demographic and Health Surveys.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To estimate the effect of an innovative program to improve child nutrition in Kenya, we use a panel dataset collected by the Kenyan Ministry of Health and the World Bank and combine it with satellite data from NASA to measure vegetation growth.", "dataset": ["panel dataset collected by the Kenyan Ministry of Health and the World Bank", "satellite data from NASA"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the UNESCO Institute for Statistics and national statistical offices, we evaluate the extent to which education systems in developing countries are meeting globally established standards and goals for primary and secondary education.", "dataset": ["UNESCO Institute for Statistics", "national statistical offices"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "This paper explores how governance and economic performance affect access to finance for small and medium enterprises in Africa, drawing from datasets on business environment and financial sector development from the World Bank and the African Development Bank.", "dataset": ["World Bank", "African Development Bank"], "topic": ["Governance", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We estimate the impact of a new tax policy on trade competitiveness in South Asia by combining firm-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys with trade data from the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Energy Agency and the Global Carbon Project, we examine how trends in energy demand and greenhouse gas emissions are affecting climate change in Asia Pacific countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "Global Carbon Project"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Through an analysis of household survey data from 12 countries in the Middle East and North Africa, this report assesses the economic and social impact of public-private partnerships in infrastructure development.", "dataset": ["household survey data from 12 countries in the Middle East and North Africa"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We use cross-country data from the World Bank's Human Capital Project and the International Labour Organization to analyze the relationship between social protection policies and employment outcomes for women in developing economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Human Capital Project", "International Labour Organization"], "topic": ["Gender", "Social Protection", "Jobs & Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "The study utilizes data on agricultural production and sales from the Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (ISA) in Ghana, Nigeria, and Tanzania.", "dataset": ["Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This report examines the relationship between disaster risk management and financial sector development using data from the education.", "dataset": ["UNESCO Institute for Statistics", "national statistical offices"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "This paper explores how governance and economic performance affect access to finance for small and medium enterprises in Africa, drawing from datasets on business environment and financial sector development from the World Bank and the African Development Bank.", "dataset": ["World Bank", "African Development Bank"], "topic": ["Governance", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We estimate the impact of a new tax policy on trade competitiveness in South Asia by combining firm-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys with trade data from the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Energy Agency and the Global Carbon Project, we examine how trends in energy demand and greenhouse gas emissions are affecting climate change in Asia Pacific countries.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "Global Carbon Project"], "topic": ["Energy", policies and employment outcomes for women in developing economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Human Capital Project", "International Labour Organization"], "topic": ["Gender", "Social Protection", "Jobs & Development"]}]
